comment: Avoid this guy if you can. His class is not hard, but he's inefficient at Information Systems (not kidding). Honestly, I was taken aback at how poorly he managed SIMNET and D2L platforms. Use spell check for every assignment. He takes grammar seriously, which is good, but he deducts points for minor errors. Very uninspiring class...

This teacher was very full of himself. He spent the first few days talking about how great he was and how the younger generations have it so easy. The class was easy. You don't have to go and test are open note. There is also a very easy group project. I simply wouldn't take him again because of his attitude.
Marquez has a specific teaching style, but engaging with it pays off. The open-book exams are manageable, but the projects require a lot of effort. Unstuckstudy was a lifesaver for exam prep.
I took him online and enjoyed his class. He was very funny and would bring in visual aids. Funny professor but not an "easy A". Long exams, you need to know Excel, but very passable with some effort.

His lectures were focused more on himself and his experiences that would only take a portion of the class time. Grading was extremely hard where each mistake no matter how small was a  WHOLE LETTER GRADE! He also seemed to be misogynistic toward females. Lastly, he only took attendance in order to use it against you later not for a grade.

He would fail on assignments for grammatical errors and score low for unnecessary reasons. His tests also consist mostly of write-out responses and does not give enough time to complete tests. Likes to give lectures about every little thing in the business world. Do not recommend!!!

Professor Marquez is very particular when it comes to the course material, often being condescending when questions are asked or arguments are made. He would grade on his own scale and take points off for things that weren't mentioned in the initial assignment. I understand what he's trying to get at, but it is unnecessary for this class.
Takes off so many points for the tiniest things. If you can avoid him never take him for a single class he teaches. Honestly just annoying and hard headed for no reason.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Marquez is an alright lecturer its just that it's useless for this class. He's your typical 80's conservative businessman (slightly misogynistic, etc.) No mandatory attendance but he assigns pop quizzes that u need to be in class for. Don't rely on someone to send u the code for the quiz bc he can find out who took the quiz outside of class.
rating_tags: Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: he was annoying tbh

He is lazy, he event does not know the exam results are wrong until he got students' feedback. He also discriminate students too. He keeps showing off his experiences as a sale person but he never applied it in his real life. He even did not mind to check student's work when there is plagiarism. He creates chance for students to steal others' work.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: very easy course. all quizzes were open note in class and test was super easy. he takes attendance and pays attention to who does things on a timely basis. he does not give slack to late assignments so make sure you turn everything in the right way. textbook was used for small papers

Raymundo is not the most likable person ever, i get that. But his IS3200 was MUCH easier than his 2200. Point criteria: { Pop quizzes (5x25 (drops one)) = 100 | Case analysis (4x50) = 200 | Group Project: Oral = 50, Written = 150 | for a total of 650} 585 is A. Harsh grader and the pop quizzes count for attendance. So you have to be there for that.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: i took him twice, his lectures are boring as hell i never showed up but there are pop quizzes so just gauge when those are handed out. his class is super easy, one group project and a final that is online and not lockdown. got an A in the class and probably showed up 5 times so if you want and easy A take him

(part 4, final). I fell into neither category and was overwhelmingly disappointed with my class experience.  He was always rude, cynical, or condescending whether in person or via email, even when initial emails on my end were polite. he needs to find some kindness toward students when communicating with them. DO NOT TAKE.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: (part 2 of another review) I was extremely disappointed with this professor, and as a result with my class experience. Often, I felt discouraged by an extremely condescending tone, and a rude demeanor, which made it difficult to reach out after initial experiences. (see part 3 for the continuation).
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: I think he's a very good teacher, he explains the subject very well. He has few projects which he grades reasonably, but you cannot slack on them. He gives two extra credit that help a lot. His 2 exams are open book which should get you As on them. If you do your work, you will have a solid A.

To cut to the chase, Professor Marquez is very brutal. He grades harshly, but sometimes that's what's needed to prepare. As a not-so-great student, I did fine. All tests, midterms, and finals are open notes. (Not many notes either, easy.) It's just the projects you need to worry about. Most of the projects take a LONG time and are graded harshly.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: I suggest taking Professor Marquez. There are two test, three projects, and extra credit. The tests are open note and exactly like the PowerPoints (EASY A). The three projects are on simple systems like excel, word, and power point. The first project is the most difficult of the class, the rest of the semester is easy.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Marquez grades everything you do way too hard and basically expects your work to be 100% perfect, if not he will give you a bad grade with ridiculous feedback. I would not recommend this professor to anyone. 0/10

He lectures everything you need to know so don't buy the book. He takes attendance as a way to see who cares (not for a grade). He is a hard grader on assignments just follow the rubric. He is super funny and is a good professor. I had him for IS2200 as well and he was the easiest A I ever got.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: Super easy class, half the time i dont even pay attention cause the tests are open note and everything can be found in his powerpoints. He is a tough grader, though, so be sure to do your best on the few assignments he does give you. Very funny man, there is not a class period where he doesn't make the class laugh.

Doesnt bore you in class and frequently ends class early. There are group projects but peer reviews are required to hold people accountable. Tests were easy because he allowed notes. He can be a tough grader if you dont listen to what he says in class
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: Mr. Marquez prides himself on the notion of preparing us for the business world. Well, to be prepared you have to prepare us. In class, he talked about anything and everything unrelated to the PowerPoint presentations and grades very nit-picky. There is a group project at the end that is graded so heavily that if you don't do well, you could fail.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: This professor has only a couple grades for the whole semester and grades them ridiculously. He will probably give you a rubric, but just know it means nothing. He rambles during his lectures and honestly just makes everything more difficult then it needs to be. Needless to say avoid Professor Marquez.

Solid professor, you'll have a midterm, final, and a few projects in this class. His lectures help grasp a good understanding of the projects. He's a funny guy who keeps the class engaged and wants his students to succeed. He is a strict grader on his projects, but he does this to get his students "ready for the real world". Test's are easy in here

He likes to talk so the lectures drag on longer than they have to, but he teaches content that is applicable in the real world. One group project at the end of the semester. Two tests both based on lectures and you can use your notes and class materials. There is one extra credit quiz. You do not need to use the textbook.
Do not take. Horrible. Tough Grader. Most will fail his first project and his business letter assignment is given with unclear directions. Do well on the projects & exams. Goodluck

I think he is a great guy but he grades ridiculously hard! We did an excel project and if the formulas were off by one character, you'd get full points off. I hope he reads this and does some internal thinking on his project. Mr. Marquez, it is extremely hard regardless of some of the walk throughs you do in class, it leaves 99% of us in a whirlwin

Do not be fooled by these positive reviews. He is a super tough grader, I cannot stress it enough. He is really rude when responding to emails. If you have not worked with excel, the project will be a struggle. He runs his class as if everyone has experience in the business world. It's manageable, but don't do it to yourself.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: Although, he can be a bit strict, he is really understanding. He grades hard on projects but if you follow the rubric, & pay attention to examples in class, you will succeed. I failed first project, did well on everything else & got an A. Never used the textbook. Do the extra credit. Check quiz grade bc he wont fix it unless you tell him.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: He is a solid choice! I do not know why he got such bad reviews because he honestly is very easy going and makes is easy to get an A. The excel project was a bit tedious but nothing extremely difficult. Few mini assignments and quizzes but nothing too bad! The group project is also pretty easy. I 100% recommend!

His class isnt hard at all! You just have to put time aside for all his assignments to make a good grade on it. He is a tough grader so for all projects especially the excel project attend all lectures and actually pay attention. Other than that one of the smoothest and relaxed classes you will sit in.
rating_tags: Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: One of the worst professors I have ever had. He is rude and he couldn't care less about his students and the class he is teaching. The work is extremely hard and instructions are very unclear. He expects you to know what you're doing without having explained it before hand.

Marquez is the worst professor i have ever had. His excel case is broadly explained. His business letter assignment gives barely any explanation and he will take off points for parts that were never mentioned on the rubric/assignment description. His tests he makes himself based off pathetic PP. Learn how to teach yourself and expect to not get A's
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: Safe yourself the trouble and do not sign up for this class. He is insanely hard with grading. If you literally misspell one word, it is 6 points off. Actually ridiculous. Attendance is mandatory and there are pop quizzes, just don't put yourself through the unneeded stress of this class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Amazing professor. If you are skilled with Excel and other business tools you can do everything last minute and get an A. Otherwise, you will have to put in some effort but it is very doable. Very funny and kind. People say he is a tough grader but really he is realistic. He will prepare you for a future in the business world. Take him if you can.

He connects the subject matter to how things really are in the corporate world. This is what I appreciate the most about him. He is very detail-oriented so make sure to proofread multiple times anything you submit.
Ray does not mess around, he's a very serious guy. He has some great stories though, ask him about personal space in Panama. Also, spell check EVERYTHING like twice.

Honestly everyone that gives him a bad rating probably just wants an easy A because professor Marquez is a very good teacher. If you just follow his rubric, ask for help, and not procrastinate you should definitely get an A

A lot of people on here are critical about Professor Raymundo. They are half right and half wrong. He is a funny guy tells you what you need to know. The material is not difficult to learn, just check the powerpoints. He is HOWEVER a pretty strict grader and lets you know he is. He has high expectations for you but it is nothing that felt unfair.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: Prof. Marquez is a solid choice for anyone taking IS. He explains his expectations during syllabus week, and you either listen or don't. Excel project takes a lot of time but he gives you the material well in advance, most of the people who scored poorly waited until the last minute to start. 3 pop quizzes, usually on fridays, and he drops one.

GO TO CLASS! he gives 3 pop quizzes and drops your lowest. A lot of the questions come from his lectures that aren't on his slides. Midterm was easy (open note). HTML wasn't that hard. Excel assignment was pretty difficult. The other assignments weren't too difficult. He is super funny and keeps class interesting, but you have to work hard.

He is the worst professor I have ever had. He rambles constantly I learned nothing in this class. He does not have a good understanding of the subject and therefore does not teach it effectively. The tests are super ambiguous and the material is not covered in the lectures. Worst of all he is one of the most apathetic professors I have ever had.

Extremely RUDE. Actually takes attendance (not for a grade. are we still in elementary school???). Excel project is actually pretty helpful in getting acquainted with the software. Business Letter is pretty easy. Group Project. 3 test. Word of advice he doesn't put much examples of the Business Letter on d2l. Make sure you ask him for clarification

Semester long group project, but fairly easy, my group got a 100. 3 tests; the first one is always super difficult, so he makes the other 2 open note. Just print of the powerpoint slides and you'll do fine. 3 other assignments as homework, make sure to run papers through Grammerly and you'll most likely make 100's on them.

He is great!! His class was straight forward and he was always willing to help. Excel project is hard, but will help you in the real world. Trust me (I learned this from internship experience) He prepares you for the real world like with excel skills and clear presentation style.

He prepares you for the business world. He's helpful, but also a picky grader. He counts a lot off for spelling and formatting, but he also suggests to use spell check and the writing center. Follow the rubric, do what he asks, take notes which help for the tests, and show up to class, gets you a B. Putting in the time and effort gets you an A.

His powerpoints and lectures do not reflect what will be on the tests. He gave us 30 minutes for a 35 question test, even though the class is 50 minutes long. I misspelled two words on a paper and he took off 20 points. He wants his students to fail.

Please do youself a service and do not take this class. Raymundo is by far the most intricate grader I have ever had. If you misspell a word he marks off a lot of points. If the assignment isn't done to perfection you will receive a bad grade. He makes this class 100x more difficult than it ever should be
He was absolutely the worst professor I have ever taken. Has no respect for his students and will say whatever he wants to you. If you want to pass IS don't take his class or you will regret it.

He tries to teach you how the business world works, and that can come off as a good or bad thing to people. There were 3 tests, 2 were open note. The assignments were kinda annoying and there is a huge group project at the end. Attendance wasn't mandatory but he did take attendance for grading reasons. I never had a real issue with the guy though.

Avoid! He is the rudest professor I have ever taken at KSU. He thinks he created the business world and everything everyone else does is wrong. He is a very nit picky grader and is very rude when asked questions, like he doesn't have time for you .He says attendance is optional then punishes students who chose not to come. Take anyone else but him.

Only get the textbook if you aren't going to come to class regularly. He takes attendance every day though, so come to class. He's really nice and is typically willing to help, but he counts off on the littlest things for projects. His study guides are extremely vague which is the only reason the test is remotely hard.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: This instructor is not even a Ph.D. and thinks he knows more than anyone else. Someone needs to talk to him about not being so great and needs to be more level headed as it pertains to himself and his students. Do not recommend at all!

This guy treats the class like it's rocket science... Takes off ridiculous points for misspelled words and other minor errors. The projects aren't that hard but make sure you double check yourself for minor things.

Second time taking him. Great professor and nice guy. Grades fairly and the class can be interesting. There is a group project but if you have a good group it is a breeze. Tests are in class on computer and from PP + Lectures. Take him, he explains things clearly and can be enjoyable
He likes to act tough, but he doesnt make his class do stuff that is that hard. although he is kind of a tough grader and grades down for alot of stuff.

He can be a bit nit picky on assignments, but he does it to prepare you for the nit pickiness of the business world. In the sense, he is a bit unorthodox. He's a great professor with easy tests. In class but online and open note (70% of the questions are on the ppts). People who say he is rude are just overly sensitive.
Pretty tedious grader, but I took him twice. Not a bad guy, just do your work and do it on time.

Professor Marquez was awesome. Two tests and a final. All three are online in class. He makes you work for your grade but it's not strenuous work. If you put forth the effort you should get a B or higher.
Look for other options.

He's really a cool dude. Grading can be a little rough and nit picky. Assigments are straight forward and he gives you plenty time to complete each one. group project was easy it could be knocked out in 5 hours collaborative tbh. He's pretty funny as well. DO NOT BUY THE CODE HE SAYS IS MANDATORY! DIDN'T USE IT AT ALL!! other than that, take him

Cool guy, whoever says he is rude has no sense of humor then. All his assignments were different and interesting, I very much enjoyed his class. Make sure you pay attention and take notes, though, easy A. Tests can be difficult unless you study.

Prof. can be tough but only to prepare you for the real world. If you regularly attend class, you have nothing to worry about because you'll hear through instructions & hints on lectures that aren't on slides. All his assignments are beneficial to the real world, and pretty easy(just put some time into it). 6 projects, 2 exams, and final.  TAKE HIM

Horrible teacher and unnecessarily grades assignments hard. Major points off for grammer and little content errors. Tests are terms based and easy. Save yourself and take someone who cares about your education and your grade! GOOD luck!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: After reading the comments, I was very worried about taking his class but I didn't have an option. Yes he can be tough but when he knows your name and sees that you regularly attend class, you have nothing to worry about. I have learned so much through his assignments and lectures. They are  pretty straight forward and so are the exams. TAKE HIM.

This teacher thinks that the only way to prepare you for the business world is simply by being a flat out jerk (a harsher word comes to mind), and teaches as if he's trying to get his students to change their major. Absolutely nothing is good enough for this guy, and odds are your self-esteem will be lower after taking this class. Take anyone else.

VERY unclear on all assignments, unhelpful in email. "Figure it out, that's what the real world is like," mentality. Everyone was lost. BUY BOOK OR CODE, NOT BOTH. Doesn't understand his own assignments! 2 exams, a few assignments, group presentation & a master level Excel project, impossible to get an A. Checks attendance daily. Don't risk it!!

Took Marquez for first IS class. Much of the same experience. You will know what to do to get the grade that you want, you just have to follow through. Has an extra credit opportunity,  use it. Study the PPTs you will be fine.

Just pay attention to power points. Not a hard class, but he's an A hole. Grades everything by spelling and grammar more than actual content. Yet, when he responds to emails (days later),it  with smart comments and makes you feel dumb WITH grammar and spelling mistakes. He's funny guy with fun lecture, but  really will lower your self view.

Boring class, but kinda easy over all. Make sure you have NO spelling errors or he will take off an absurd amount of points on an assignment. He is somewhat sexist with his comments and preference. Big Group project, make sure you pick a good group bc it is a lot of work and a big part of your grade. 3 open note tests, final, and 5 in class quizzes

Easy A! Just go to class and listen to his powerpoints. Only 6 quizzes, 2 exams and a final. All you have to do is study the ppt slides. The only issue I had is his favortism toward guys.  When a guy would ask a obvious question he would jump to amswer it, but when a lady asked, he would not give an answer and just say "ask around."

After the Fall 2014 semester, he must have been offended so many people were saying he was "easy". He  has really made the class more difficult. Almost weekly quizzes, tests with fill-in-the-blanks that you have to take online in class. He acts like a high school bully so you better hope you don't ask the wrong question . Would not recommend.

This professor is very easy. You should come to class the first half of the semester because he takes the roll (not for a grade, but if you ask for extra credit or for him to bump you up a point, he will look at your attendance), but the second half of the semester is based on your teams that you will be in, and they will hold you accountable-TAKE!

Dude is a really harsh grader and expects you to know the PowerPoint material verbatim. Takes more points off for misspellings than English teachers and the smallest mistake in an otherwise perfect semester will almost certainly leave you on the border of getting a C or a B.  Much better professors out there than this guy.

The rudest teacher I have ever seen!! He thinksacts like a know-it-all person. FOn the first day of class he said that "non of you guys can become a major character in the busniness world in future!!" LOL. Dude!!! My business is making over 100K a year while I'm in school, what the heck are you talking about??  Any how, avoid this guy at any cost

BEST Professor at KSU hands down. I hate 8am classes, but he's worth taking. He makes the class as simple as possible and funny. Great if you need an easy class. As long as you fix any grammatical errors in your writing and show up to class occassionally you will get at least a B. Put in a little more effort and an A is SO possible. Take HIM!!!!!

Decent teacher.  Projects are easy if you pay attention to what he wants and what he goes over in class.  Not the best when it comes to help, he'll usually tell you to use your resources to find some help.  I would take him again.

This instructor seem to have much knowledge for this course as it related to background, but his education was questionable. Rude and stuck up at times since he thought he was better than anyone else in the room. Needs to concentrate more on the subject rather than himself. I would not recommend taking him for this class.

Took this instructor for Spring Semester 2014 and found him to be very rude and arrogant. Wanted to drop the course, but it was too late. Brags about himself all the time and if you ask him any questions, he comes back with a smart remark. I would suggest taking someone else for this course.
Easy A.  If you actually learn something, find another teacher

Prof. Marquez is a fantastic teacher. This is the second class I have had him for.  He will bend over backward to help you, but only if you are willing to put forth some effort. He can get a little distracted with his stories, but if you pay attention you will realize that the stories are relevant to what we are discussing. He's one of my favorites

Attendance not mandatory. I felt the class was easy. Powerpoint lectures kind of boring but helpful. Group project, but I thought it was super easy. Quizzes and exams are online. Everything is open book

Super easy class but if you have any questions at all, don't even bother asking. Tests are online. HE IS THE RUDEST PROFESSOR IVE EVER HAD. Every time I emailed him, he had a smart comment about lacking attention to detail or etc. and then didn't even answer the question.  Shouldn't be employed as an educator. Needs to go back into the work force

Marquez is a good teacher. There are a few big projects and and easy midterm and final. He gives you info about class and preparation for life in general. Projects will take some time, and group project is a big one with a presentation. He is a fair grader, just go to class and youll do fine. Pretty easy A

Marquez prepares students for the real-world. Nice, funny guy. Warning: 1st project is HARD! If you're good with excel/formulas you'll be fine but I was in tears & almost dropped. 2nd half of the semester is spent on a HUGE group project. Choose WISELY! I enjoyed group work & learned A LOT! Midterm & final are easy. Got an A in this class.

Professor Marquez is a great professor. His lectures are thorough even if boring at times. He tries to inject some humor into his lectures to keep it interesting and relates information to his life for examples, which is helpful. Only downfall is his group project, which is an absolute chore because of scheduling.

Nice guy, interesting class. His lectures are long and get boring at times. I wish he would keep his lectures concise as much as he preaches to his class to be in out work we turn in. Other than that I believe this is an easy A

great teacher!..strict on grading..so just DO what he ask. takes off points for misspelling and does not give extra credit. Great business guy, i would definitely take him again..ALSO make sure you get to know people in his class, it will come in handy for the excel project.

Great Professor! Attendance is not mandatory but he gives a lot of explanations and helpful directions in class. Midterm and a final but he makes a study guide. Also a big group project which is pretty easy. Overall, I would recommend Professor Marquez.

You have to come to class to get A's on the projects because it's the only way you'll know what to do. His test are surprisingly tricky, but you can take the final online in class using notes. Half of what we did felt irrelevant to the material. He's strict on the presentation and excel project grading. Don't mess up on those if you want an A.

Interesting teacher.  It was nice to have someone who worked in the corporate world and is now teaching.  Only 2 major projects which can be a little time consuming, but they are useful projects. Don't buy the book.
Professor M, Was an excellent teacher. He made the class very interesting with all the projects we had to do. It was great learning about software on the back end.

He was a great teacher, I was not really interested in the material but he made it fun. He tells a lot of jokes abd plays music at the beginning of every class. The group projects are cool as long as you don't have lazy group members!

Very straight-forward and business like. He is very knowledgeable after a successful career. We didn't use a book, the midterm and final were from the powerpoints and lectures. There is a group project at the end, but it will be fine if you partner with good people. I would definitely recommend him to everyone.

He's entertaining.  You should already know Excel and Word before taking this class.  He gives 2-3 projects that take some time to do, but are pretty easy if you know Excel and Word.  Also, you'll form teams and have to build a website, so make sure you grab a team member who knows how to do this.  Do not get textbook.

I enjoyed him a lot. Yes the class is boring, but he's funny which makes up for it. textbook not required at all so don't bother buying it. he lectures off powerpoints and posts them that's all you need to study. great professor!

This class is boring and pointless. However, he makes it easy so I do recommend taking him since all business majors have to take it. There are only 2 tests and several small projects. The 2nd half of the class is group-based so make sure you get with reliable people! He also loves to talk (about himself mostly), so beware cause it gets annoying.

I took his class over the summer with two other classes and got an A. I enjoyed his class and learned some useful skills I can see myself using in the business world. He provides real life applications of what he's teaching. This class was not hard to sit through and he dismissed class early a good amount of times. I would reccomend him to anybody!
He is awesome. This class was easy and informative. This is stuff you will actually use in life. Best class at KSU hands down.

Mr. Marquez is a very clear and organized Professor. His lectures are interesting and very helpful for the students. All of the activites in the class are hands on and useful. I would reccomend other students take his class, as well. You do have to read his instructions very closely, in order to do well in the class. He is allright.

TAKE HIM!!! He is an amazing professor and very helpful. I actually learned a lot taking his classes. You do not need the book if you come to class. IF you have a problem going to class do not take him you wont pass. Assignments are fair and grading is as well.  Group project at the end is a lot of work so pick a good group!

He is very helpful but I cant decide if he wants his class to be super difficult or super easy. We had a bit of a dry spell after the mid term and then he assigned a 30 page group project along with the final but eh its do able as long as he grades easily considering the small time frame we had. I would recommend him. Get a good group!

I was very fearful of this class; however, Professor Marquez madethat fear disappear.  He is very willing to answer any questions, easy test if you come to class. One group project.  Make sure all persons are willing to not only do their part,but that they all meet visually prior to the final submission of the group project. Take Him!
Awesome Professor...come to class and you will do fine. Test questions come from lectures. The book is not mandatory, but is a good reference book to have.

Great Teacher! I got all A's on assignments. If you go to class you should get an A or B! At first he comes off mean...but he's actually a great guy! He's the best BISM prof. Don't buy book! Listen to lectures...everything he says is on his midterm and final. Pick a good group at beginning! GO TO CLASS :)

Professor Marquez was pretty easy and entertaining.  Class was randomly mandatory, but it wasn't a bad class to have to go to.  You can use the computers in class and choose to pay attention or not.  If you give any effort whatsoever it's an easy B.  I messed up on the midterm, so I got a B, but an A is very attainable.  Take him if u can!

BISM 2100 is a very easy class in general but he makes it even easier.  Good teacher though and explains how stuff can be used in the real world.  Very willing to help and seems to want all his students to make an A.  I would definitely take a class with him again

Excellent Professor!  Introduced and discussed assignments in detail.  Very patient when answering questions about assignments.  He let us pick our own teams.  He reffered to the text book but we did not have to read it for class.  It is an excellent reference book and will come in handy when you are working on your formal report.

I got an A on ALL assignments AND tests. There is one excel project that's a little lengthy and  does seem a bit intimidating at first, but got an A on it and I love excel now.All tests are online open book/note/whatever. You should buy the book only for tests because they come straight from it. GREAT TEACHER! Very  nice. Take him take him take HIM
Good professor, he takes way to many points for small detailes on projects. I would take him again! GREAT GUY

Nice guy.Besides the fact that I had him at 8 a.m, the class was ok.I stopped coming for a while because he sent us all the slides.Tests are open EVERYTHING so they are not too hard.Assignments were a breeze but be sure to pick a good group cuz group assignments are a big part of your total grade.I would take him again.Easy A/B!!

The class did not follow very closely to the syllabus at times and I felt that the grading system was not very well explained. He often focused too much on small portions of projects when grading them instead of the project as a whole. Still, I made an A in the class and most of the material was a super easy. He's an easy A.
Great professor. Easier group project than other bism 2100s, but its all lumped into last month which gave time constraints so be careful of who you group with. tests open book/note/internet

Great Prof!! He worked for IBM for 25 years, you will learn a lot. Only two test online open book, notes and internet! Group project that makes up 35 % of the grade. He cut the oral presentation out becuase we ran out of time, just had to do voiceovers. Take him it won't get any easier!!

Super easy. Nice guy, easy teacher. My only problem is that this class is pretty much useless. I learned nothing about word, excel, or powerpoint that I didn't already know. Waste of time, but KSU is making a killing off of it.

Fun guy, makes lectures engaging & interesting. Has lots of experience in business so listen to him! Tests are online & you can use book, notes and computer. Projects aren't hard, pay attention to your grammar and spelling! I was dreading the group paper & presentation but it wasn't bad at all, gave lots of time in class to work on group project.

Professor Marquez keeps his class engaged.  He has a great sense of humor and is willing to work with you to ensure you get the most out of the class.  He is very professional in his demeanor but is not afraid to show his personal side from time to time.
Great Professor!!!

Professor Marquez has to be one of the best teachers I've ever had a KSU. He is funny and makes this class fly by. He knows what he's talking about. In this class you are constantly doing something, but then again this also gives you more grades. He gives extra credit, and takes attendance randomly. I LOVED HIM! You'd be lucky to take him!

Such a cool guy, really funny and keeps your attention if u have him in the morning. Very easy tests, just 2. Everything else is assignments, i liked them all. First one was the toughest. Group project at the end of semester where you have to speak in front of class. i thought it was fun :) i got an A!

Great class!  It helped that I already knew a lot about Microsoft Office.  His lectures are highly entertaining, plus the tests are straight out of the lecture notes so go to every class and *pay attention* because the textbook is useless.  I wish he taught 3100!

Mr. Marquez will bluff in the beginning by making the course appear hard and loaded with work, but he just wants to cut class size. Projects are easy, but attend class; entertaining guy. You will have to do a public speaking project but this is business...you're going to have to do it eventually.

A fair grader. Relates his business experience to material. A mid term and final along with lots of projects make for a challenging course. A group project that makes up almost 38% of your grade will require you to search out committed and serious teammates. Start looking for them early!

Excellent Professor who is demanding, but not rigid. Grades fairly, and motivates you to make an A. I learned a lot of practical business information and thought the oral presentation helped build confidence,  and all the projects were useful.
keeps the class entertained, very helpful & integrates real life experiences. Kudos!
